1470.question: So this paper turns unstructured text inputs to parameters that GNNs can read?

4-Figure2-1.png: Yes, the paper converts unstructured text inputs into vector representations that graph neural networks (GNNs) can process. This is done by an encoding module which takes a sequence of vector representations as inputs and outputs a transition matrix. The propagation module then uses this transition matrix to propagate hidden states from nodes to their neighbors. Finally, a classification module provides task-related predictions based on the node representations.
